timeline.message:
Release UGI if there is an error during the filter execution

When the filter execution fails, for example when accessing a
non-existing HCFS path, the fragmenter call will throw an
InvalidInputException. This causes all segments to leave the UGI entry
available, and the FileSystem associated to the UGI does not get closed
until the UGI entry is expired 15 minutes earlier. This commit eagerly
closes UGI resources when an exception occurs.

Remove Configuration from SessionId

The Configuration in SessionId was only being used to check whether
security is enabled for the given server. But the Configuration being in
the SessionId brings a lot of issues, because when SessionIds are being
kept in the UGICache, they would retain a lot of associated objects in
memory. This would cause in some cases hundreds of megabytes in memory
just for the purpose of keeping a single field from Configuration. This
commit we only store the `isSecurityEnabled` boolean in the SessionId,
as it is the only piece of information that we need to keep.
